summary: A neural network layer that aggregates temporal features by computing the average (and optionally the standard deviation) across the time axis of a [B, D, T] tensor, yielding a [B, D] representation. It supports two pooling strategies—simple mean (time‑average pooling) and a combined mean‑plus‑std (x‑vector) mode—with configurable epsilon for numerical stability and an option to use a biased variance estimator.
business_intent: Enable downstream models to obtain compact, fixed‑size embeddings from variable‑length sequences, facilitating tasks such as speaker verification, speech recognition, or any application requiring temporal summarization of feature maps.
